translation.appDescription: Customizable new tab: compose your own page from widgets
translation.title: Title

general.title: General
general.newTabTitleHint: We can't set icon for new page, but you can try using emoji here ðŸ˜‰
general.analyticsHintP1: Analytics helps me better understand how users interact with Anori and which features are used the most. It doesn't share any private info like content of notes or URL of bookmarks.
general.analyticsHintP2: This helps me to develop better product so I ask you to enable sending analytics.
general.stealFocusHint: If enabled, this will force browser to move focus from address bar to this page when opening new tab and you will be able to use command menu (Cmd+K) without needing to move focus to page manually (by clicking or pressing Tab).
general.automaticCompact: Automatically switch to compact mode based on screen size
general.showAnimationOnOpenHint: If enabled, extension will show quick loading animation which will hide initial flicker of loading data and provide better look.

customIcons.title: Custom icons
customIcons.incorrectFormat: Please provide valid file(s). Anori supports .png, .jpg, .gif, .jpeg and .svg
customIcons.noIcons: You don't have any custom icons yet.
customIcons.invalidNames: Some of icons have invalid name, please fix them before saving.
customIcons.supportedFormats: We support png, jpg, gif and svg and recommend using square images with size between 128 and 256 pixels (not applicable to svg).

importExport.title: Import & export
importExport.info: Here you can backup your settings or restore older backup.

aboutHelp.title: Help & about the extension
aboutHelp.onlyEnglishPlease: I (author of the project) don't speak a lot of languages, so please file your issues in English. Thanks!
aboutHelp.p1: Anori is free and open source extension. Source code can be found on <0>GitHub</0>. If you would like to propose a feature or report a bug, please create <1>new issue</1> in repository. If you just want to say thanks you can give a star to that repo :).
aboutHelp.p2: If you would like to modify this extension, add you own plugin or widget, please refer to <0>readme</0> for more info.

shortcuts.title: Shortcuts
shortcuts.closeMenuOrModal: Close command menu or modal window
shortcuts.switchToNFolder: Switch to 1st folder (works with other numbers too!)
shortcuts.addNewWidget: Add new widget to current folder

onboarding.title: Fresh start, huh?
onboarding.p1: Hello! I'm onboarding card, and my mission here is to help you set up your perfect new tab.
onboarding.p2: Click on pencil in top right corner. This will switch the page into editing mode. Here you can add new widgets and reposition or remove existing ones.
onboarding.p3: If you click on the gear icon in the bottom left corner, you'll open settings. There you can manage your folders (which you find on the sidebar to the left) and change theme.
onboarding.p4: Oh, and we also have a command menu for quick access. Just hit <0 /> (explore more shortcuts by pressing <1 />).
onboarding.p5: This card will disappear once you add your first widget.

commandMenu.name: Global Command Menu
commandMenu.noWidgets: Nothing here yet. Try adding some widgets to folder.

requirePermissions.compactText: Additional permissions required. Click to see details.
requirePermissions.text: This widget requires additional permissions. Those are:

notes-plugin.name: Notes
notes-plugin.exampleText: Veggies, ketchup, cheese, flour, olive oil

tasks-plugin.name: Tasks
tasks-plugin.exampleTask0: Stupid walk for stupid mental health
